Perjury.origin: [Anglo-French perjurie parjurie , from Latin perjurium , from perjurus deliberately giving false testimony, from per- detrimental to + jur- jus law]

-ries.definition: [Anglo-French, from Latin, fromdeliberately giving false testimony, fromdetrimental to +law]the act or crime of knowingly making a false statement (as about a material matter) while under oath or bound by an affirmation or other officially prescribed declaration that what one says, writes, or claims is true compare
